channel.title: Music
channel.description: NPR Music features, streams, live concerts and music news.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Glenn Jones' Bittersweet 'Farewell' To A Family Home
item.description: For this video, Jones performs "Bergen County Farewell" in singer-songwriter Meg Baird's living room in Allentown, N.J. It's the same place he recorded his fifth solo album, My Garden State.
item.content:encoded:
For this video, Jones performs "Bergen County Farewell" in singer-songwriter Meg Baird's living room in Allentown, N.J. It's the same place he recorded his fifth solo album, My Garden State.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: How Taxes And Moving Changed The Sound Of Jazz
item.description: As NPR's employees file their federal returns and take up shop in a new building, we look back at an interesting historical moment in the 1940s. A cabaret tax led to more jazz being performed in smaller venues that couldn't accommodate dancing. Of course, that's not the only reason why bebop sounds the way it does.
item.content:encoded:
As NPR's employees file their federal returns and take up shop in a new building, we look back at an interesting historical moment in the 1940s. A cabaret tax led to more jazz being performed in smaller venues that couldn't accommodate dancing. Of course, that's not the only reason why bebop sounds the way it does.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Carnegie Hall Live: Dresden Staatskapelle Plays Bruckner
item.description: When the venerable orchestra brings Bruckner's Eighth Symphony to New York, listeners will hear an ensemble completely comfortable with the composer's quirks and thrills. Hear what one critic calls a "mesmerizing experience."
item.content:encoded:
When the venerable orchestra brings Bruckner's Eighth Symphony to New York, listeners will hear an ensemble completely comfortable with the composer's quirks and thrills. Hear what one critic calls a "mesmerizing experience."

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Rachel Zeffira: An Opera 'Deserter' Embraces Dreamy Pop
item.description: The singer and composer plays more than eight different instruments on her haunting solo debut, The Deserters, which includes a cover of My Bloody Valentine's "To Here Knows When."
item.content:encoded:
The singer and composer plays more than eight different instruments on her haunting solo debut, The Deserters, which includes a cover of My Bloody Valentine's "To Here Knows When."

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Appreciating A Pillar Of The Chicago Sound: Trumpeter Bud Herseth
item.description: The legendary musician, widely adored by brass players and fans around the globe, spent 53 years as the principal in the Chicago Symphony Orchestra. He died Saturday at age 91. Watch some of his performances, including an extraordinary Mahler Fifth Symphony.
item.content:encoded:
The legendary musician, widely adored by brass players and fans around the globe, spent 53 years as the principal in the Chicago Symphony Orchestra. He died Saturday at age 91. Watch some of his performances, including an extraordinary Mahler Fifth Symphony.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Lady Lamb The Beekeeper On World Cafe
item.description: Singer-songwriter Aly Spaltro wrote most of the songs on her debut album, Ripley Pine, while working at a DVD store in Portland, Maine. Here, she plays songs from the album and discusses breaking into music.
item.content:encoded:
Singer-songwriter Aly Spaltro wrote most of the songs on her debut album, Ripley Pine, while working at a DVD store in Portland, Maine. Here, she plays songs from the album and discusses breaking into music.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Kathleen Edwards On Mountain Stage
item.description: The Canadian singer-songwriter makes her second appearance on Mountain Stage, performing songs from her most recent album, Voyageur. Her set includes a song, "Chameleon/Comedian," which wasn't heard during the radio broadcast.
item.content:encoded:
The Canadian singer-songwriter makes her second appearance on Mountain Stage, performing songs from her most recent album, Voyageur. Her set includes a song, "Chameleon/Comedian," which wasn't heard during the radio broadcast.

item.title: Low: Every Note In Its Right Place
item.description: Low's Alan Sparhawk, Mimi Parker and Steve Garrington recently put on a special show for their fellow Minnesotans at St. Paul's Fitzgerald Theater. Watch them perform "Plastic Cup" and "So Blue," from The Invisible Way, with assistance from their hometown friends in Trampled by Turtles.
item.content:encoded:
Low's Alan Sparhawk, Mimi Parker and Steve Garrington recently put on a special show for their fellow Minnesotans at St. Paul's Fitzgerald Theater. Watch them perform "Plastic Cup" and "So Blue," from The Invisible Way, with assistance from their hometown friends in Trampled by Turtles.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: South By South Africa: 5 Jazz Acts From The Rainbow Nation
item.description: For centuries, the country turned its back on black musicians — including the jazz artists whose creations embodied freedom and empowerment. Today, the Cape Town International Jazz Festival is one of Africa's largest musical gatherings. Here are five musicians who played the festival this year.
item.content:encoded:
For centuries, the country turned its back on black musicians — including the jazz artists whose creations embodied freedom and empowerment. Today, the Cape Town International Jazz Festival is one of Africa's largest musical gatherings. Here are five musicians who played the festival this year.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Caroline Shaw, 30, Wins Pulitzer For Music
item.description: The versatile composer, violinist and vocalist is one of just a handful of female musicians to earn the prize — and, at age 30, the youngest music winner ever. Her 'Partita for 8 Voices' was written for the debut recording by the vocal ensemble with which she performs, Roomful of Teeth.
item.content:encoded:
The versatile composer, violinist and vocalist is one of just a handful of female musicians to earn the prize — and, at age 30, the youngest music winner ever. Her 'Partita for 8 Voices' was written for the debut recording by the vocal ensemble with which she performs, Roomful of Teeth.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Dumbfoundead: A Rising Star In A Genre In Transition
item.description: Despite the prominence of Asian artists in several aspects of hip-hop, they're still not the most visible performers in the genre. Dumbfoundead wants to be an exception.
item.content:encoded:
Despite the prominence of Asian artists in several aspects of hip-hop, they're still not the most visible performers in the genre. Dumbfoundead wants to be an exception.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Local Natives On World Cafe
item.description: The indie-rock group from LA plays songs from its latest release, Hummingbird, and talks about recording the sun-drenched album.
item.content:encoded:
The indie-rock group from LA plays songs from its latest release, Hummingbird, and talks about recording the sun-drenched album.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Next: Escondido
item.description: Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros' Tyler James and fashion designer Jessica Maros met in 2011 and bonded over a mutual love of Ennio Morricone's spaghetti Western soundtracks. Hear two tracks from the duo's debut album, The Ghost of Escondido, which was recorded live in one day.
item.content:encoded:
Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros' Tyler James and fashion designer Jessica Maros met in 2011 and bonded over a mutual love of Ennio Morricone's spaghetti Western soundtracks. Hear two tracks from the duo's debut album, The Ghost of Escondido, which was recorded live in one day.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Nick Cave And The Bad Seeds, Live In Concert: SXSW 2013
item.description: Sinewy and powerful as ever, and backed by his longtime band, Nick Cave works the crowd like a revival preacher at half-speed during a career-spanning set at NPR Music's SXSW showcase at Stubb's in Austin, Texas. Watch Cave perform "Jubilee Street," "From Her to Eternity" and "Push the Sky Away," and hear audio of his full set.
item.content:encoded:
Sinewy and powerful as ever, and backed by his longtime band, Nick Cave works the crowd like a revival preacher at half-speed during a career-spanning set at NPR Music's SXSW showcase at Stubb's in Austin, Texas. Watch Cave perform "Jubilee Street," "From Her to Eternity" and "Push the Sky Away," and hear audio of his full set.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Yo La Tengo: Tiny Desk Concert
item.description: Yo La Tengo's sound has evolved quite a bit since Georgia Hubley and Ira Kaplan first jammed together in 1984; the feedback has subsided, replaced by a more contemplative vibe. To coincide with the release of the band's 13th album, Fade, Yo La Tengo performs an acoustic set behind Bob Boilen's desk.
item.content:encoded:
Yo La Tengo's sound has evolved quite a bit since Georgia Hubley and Ira Kaplan first jammed together in 1984; the feedback has subsided, replaced by a more contemplative vibe. To coincide with the release of the band's 13th album, Fade, Yo La Tengo performs an acoustic set behind Bob Boilen's desk.
